intro: Urostigma clusioides, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Urostigma clusioides is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
